page.title: 17A Day in My Life
page.content: I am a {diabetic} which means I have to have a high fibre{diet.}I do not have sugar in my tea or even on cereals like "Weetabix" and "Bran Flakes" etc. I must only have one pint of pasteurised milk a day, the rest has to be skimmed. I have to have two {insulin}injections a day or else I will die. I can have{sweets}some times but if I do I must have even more exercise otherwise my sugar will go up and I will feel sick. And if I don't have enough I will go low and I will pass out. Its very hard to keep stable and not to be able to eat{ {sweets}and sometimes I give in. I hope in the future there will be a cure. (Written by Leesa Wells, pupil at Dinnington Comprehensive, aged 13 years).
